org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction

Interface Transaction


  • public interface Transaction
    Represents a transaction in the XFlat database.
    While in context and open, the database will operate with the isolation level specified in the TransactionOptions given at the time this transaction was opened.

    When committed, the data modified by this transaction will be durably saved to disk, and immediately will be available to transactionless reads as well as new transactions.

    When closed, if a transaction has not been committed, it will be automatically reverted.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getCommitId()
      Gets the commit ID of this transaction.
      long getTransactionId()
      Gets the ID of this transaction.
      boolean isCommitted()
      Returns true if the transaction scope to which this transaction belongs has been committed.
      boolean isReadOnly()
      Returns true if the current transaction scope was opened with the ReadOnly option set.
      boolean isReverted()
      Returns true if the transaction scope to which this transaction belongs has been reverted.

    • Method Detail

      • getTransactionId

        long getTransactionId()
        Gets the ID of this transaction. A Transaction's ID is linked to the time it was created, so a transaction with a higher ID is guaranteed to have been created later. Transaction IDs are also valid across multiple tables.
        Returns:
        The transaction's ID.

      • getCommitId

        long getCommitId()
        Gets the commit ID of this transaction. A transaction has a commit ID if it has been committed. This commit ID is also linked to the time it was created, and can be compared to other transaction IDs to see if this transaction was committed before, during, or after another transaction.
        Returns:
        The transaction's commit ID, or -1 if uncommitted.

      • isCommitted

        boolean isCommitted()
        Returns true if the transaction scope to which this transaction belongs has been committed.

        This refers to the entire transaction scope; if this transaction's scope was opened within a larger transaction scope (except by Propagation.NESTED), then calling TransactionScope.commit() on the scope will not result in a commit and this will return false until the larger scope is committed.

        Returns:
        true iff the entire ambient transaction successfully committed.

      • isReverted

        boolean isReverted()
        Returns true if the transaction scope to which this transaction belongs has been reverted.

        If this transaction's scope was propagated from a larger transaction scope (except by Propagation.NESTED), then this will return true if TransactionScope.revert() has been called on ANY transaction scope participating in the transaction.

        Returns:
        true iff the entire ambient transaction was reverted.

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns true if the current transaction scope was opened with the ReadOnly option set.
        Returns:
        true if the current transaction is read only.
        See Also:
        TransactionOptions.getReadOnly()
